definition: to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: A three-year-old kid was so fascinated by the music that he forgot everything around.
sentences.chinese: 最捧場的是一位三歲小童，聽得入神。

sentences.english: No wonder the loudest applause came from the claque.
sentences.chinese: 毫不奇怪，最響的掌聲來自劇院僱來的捧場人。

sentences.english: However, the flattery of the bourgeoisie may conquer the weak-willed in our ranks.
sentences.chinese: 資產階級的捧場則可能征服我們隊伍中的意志薄弱者。

sentences.english: Most of the seats reserved for A-list guests went begging .
sentences.chinese: 大多數爲高級來賓保留的座位都空着乏人捧場。

sentences.english: I can only thank you for it and I start off again.
sentences.chinese: 我只能感謝你們捧場，然後再重新開始。

sentences.english: However, they may cheat more people to attend the contests by changing their banner.
sentences.chinese: 改旗易幟，或許會多矇騙幾個人前來捧場。

sentences.english: The style below contains phrases appropriate for most write-ups.
sentences.chinese: 下述風格包含了對大多數捧場文章都適用的短語。

sentences.english: You receive such an honor, even professor Li has come here for you.
sentences.chinese: 你真夠面子，連李教授都來爲你捧場。

sentences.english: These snacks at the night market food stalls often join in the entry is the greatest.
sentences.chinese: 這些小喫在夜市大排檔裏往往捧場的入是最多的。

definition: bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
to stand in a circle and watch
filled to capacity (of theater, stadium, gymnasium etc)
to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
(formal) to honor with one's presence/to attend
